shortDescription: Tibetan exile capital with monasteries, cafés, and Himalayan treks
description: McLeod Ganj, the residence of the Dalai Lama and heart of the Tibetan exile community, offers a unique blend of spirituality, adventure, and café culture. Trek to Triund for stunning mountain views, explore Tibetan monasteries, and savor momos while soaking in the bohemian backpacker vibe of this charming hill station.
landscape: Hill station, Tibetan culture, Dharamshala, Himalayan views
bestSeason: March to June, September to November
seasonNote: Pleasant weather for trekking. Monsoon (July–August) has heavy rainfall. Check for Dalai Lama's public teachings schedule.
keyAttractions: Tsuglagkhang Complex — Dalai Lama's residence and main temple
Triund Trek — Popular overnight trek with stunning Dhauladhar views
Bhagsu Waterfall — Scenic cascade with famous Shiva Café nearby
Norbulingka Institute — Tibetan arts, crafts, and culture center
Tibetan Museum — History of Tibet and the exile journey

itinerary.title: Travel Day
itinerary.plan: Train: Kolkata → Pathankot (overnight). Or fly to Dharamshala.

itinerary.title: Arrival & Exploration
itinerary.plan: Road: Pathankot → McLeod Ganj (4 hours). Tsuglagkhang Complex evening visit.

itinerary.title: Bhagsu Day
itinerary.plan: Bhagsu Nag Temple + Bhagsu Waterfall + Shiva Café + evening market stroll

itinerary.title: Triund Trek
itinerary.plan: Triund trek (day trek or overnight camping). Stunning Dhauladhar panoramas.

itinerary.title: Culture Day
itinerary.plan: Tibetan Museum + Norbulingka Institute + local Tibetan markets + momos

itinerary.title: Viewpoints
itinerary.plan: Dharamkot village + Naddi viewpoint sunrise + St. John's Church + cafés

itinerary.title: Departure
itinerary.plan: McLeod Ganj → Pathankot → Train/Flight to Kolkata

bookingTips: Check Dalai Lama's public teachings schedule online — life-changing experience
Tibetan cafés offer great food at reasonable prices — try thukpa and momos
Book Triund camping in advance during peak season (April–June)
Carry warm layers — evenings are cold even in summer
Explore Dharamkot for quieter yoga retreats and cafés

shortDescription: World-class paragliding site with Tibetan monasteries and tea gardens
description: Bir Billing, host of the 2015 Paragliding World Cup, offers India's best tandem paragliding experience. Soar from Billing (2,400m) to land in Bir village while enjoying 20-30 minutes of Himalayan views. Beyond flying, explore Tibetan monasteries, trek through tea gardens, and enjoy the laid-back backpacker café culture.
landscape: Paragliding capital of India, tea gardens, Tibetan settlements
bestSeason: March to June, September to November
seasonNote: Best paragliding weather. Avoid monsoon (July–August) — no flying possible. October–November has clearest skies.
keyAttractions: Paragliding — World-class tandem flights from Billing to Bir
Chokling Monastery — Beautiful Tibetan monastery with ancient murals
Tea Gardens — Scenic walks through lush tea plantations
Gunehar Waterfall — Hidden gem waterfall near Bir
Billing Takeoff Site — Trek up for stunning valley views

itinerary.title: Travel Day
itinerary.plan: Train: Kolkata → Pathankot (overnight). Or fly to Dharamshala + taxi.

itinerary.title: Arrival
itinerary.plan: Road: Pathankot → Bir (5 hours). Evening Chokling Monastery visit.

itinerary.title: Flying Day
itinerary.plan: Paragliding from Billing to Bir (main activity!) + video/photos + celebration

itinerary.title: Monastery Circuit
itinerary.plan: Tibetan colony + Palpung Sherabling Monastery + tea garden walk

itinerary.title: Trek Day
itinerary.plan: Trek to Billing takeoff site (14 km) + village exploration + sunset views

itinerary.title: Waterfall & Chill
itinerary.plan: Gunehar waterfall + camping/relaxation + local café hopping

itinerary.title: Departure
itinerary.plan: Bir → Pathankot → Train/Flight to Kolkata

bookingTips: Book paragliding with CERTIFIED operators only — safety first
Early morning flights have best thermals and views
Bir has excellent café culture — try June 16 Café and Zostel
Trek to Billing early morning for sunrise — magical experience
Combine with McLeod Ganj for complete Himachal experience

shortDescription: Peaceful cantonment town with India's highest waterfall and pristine forests
description: Chakrata, a quiet cantonment town at 2,118m, remains one of India's best-kept secrets. Home to Tiger Falls (312 ft, Uttarakhand's highest), ancient Deoban forests, and the unique Jaunsar tribal culture, it offers the peace that popular hill stations have lost. Perfect for those seeking solitude in the Himalayas.
landscape: Quiet hill station, deodar forests, Tiger Falls
permits: Some areas require permits (Jaunsar tribal region)
bestSeason: March to June, September to November
seasonNote: Pleasant weather for trekking. Winter (December–February) brings snowfall. Very offbeat — no crowds.
keyAttractions: Tiger Falls — 312 ft waterfall, highest in Uttarakhand
Deoban Peak — Pristine deodar forests with Himalayan views
Chilmiri Neck — Panoramic sunset viewpoint
Budher Caves — Ancient rock formations and caves
Jaunsar Villages — Unique tribal culture and traditions

itinerary.title: Travel Day
itinerary.plan: Train: Kolkata → Dehradun (overnight). Or fly to Dehradun.

itinerary.title: Hill Arrival
itinerary.plan: Road: Dehradun → Chakrata (3 hours). Evening deodar forest walk.

itinerary.title: Tiger Falls
itinerary.plan: Tiger Falls trek (5 km) — Uttarakhand's highest waterfall. Swimming if weather permits.

itinerary.title: Deoban Trek
itinerary.plan: Deoban peak trek through pristine forests + panoramic Himalayan views

itinerary.title: Viewpoints
itinerary.plan: Chilmiri Neck sunrise + Budher caves exploration + photography

itinerary.title: Tribal Culture
itinerary.plan: Jaunsar tribal village visit + local culture + relaxation + sunset walk

itinerary.title: Departure
itinerary.plan: Chakrata → Dehradun → Train/Flight to Kolkata

bookingTips: Army cantonment town — peaceful atmosphere with minimal tourists
Tiger Falls trek is moderate — wear good shoes, carry water
Winter brings snowfall — beautiful but prepare for cold
Limited restaurants — many hotels include meals
Perfect weekend escape from Delhi (6-7 hours drive)

shortDescription: Spectacular mountain panoramas with ancient monasteries and sacred lakes
description: Pelling offers arguably the most dramatic views of Kanchenjunga, the world's third-highest peak. Wake up to golden sunrise on snow-clad peaks, explore 17th-century monasteries, and visit sacred wish-fulfilling lakes. The Pelling Skywalk and Singshore Bridge add modern thrills to this scenic Himalayan paradise.
permits: ILP required for certain areas (apply at Rangpo/Gangtok)
bestSeason: March to May, October to November
seasonNote: Clear mountain views. October–November has crystal clear skies. Monsoon has clouds blocking peaks.
keyAttractions: Kanchenjunga Views — World's third-highest peak sunrise panorama
Pemayangtse Monastery — 17th century, one of Sikkim's oldest and holiest
Khecheopalri Lake — Sacred wish-fulfilling lake
Pelling Skywalk — Glass-bottom walkway with valley views
Singshore Bridge — Highest bridge in Sikkim (198m)

itinerary.title: Travel Day
itinerary.plan: Train: Kolkata → NJP. Shared taxi to Pelling (5 hours). Evening Kanchenjunga sunset.

itinerary.title: Mountain Morning
itinerary.plan: Early Kanchenjunga sunrise from hotel + Pemayangtse Monastery + Rabdentse ruins

itinerary.title: Monastery Day
itinerary.plan: Sangachoeling Monastery trek + afternoon rest + evening market walk

itinerary.title: Lake & Falls
itinerary.plan: Khecheopalri Lake + Kanchenjunga Falls + Rimbi waterfalls + picnic

itinerary.title: Modern Thrills
itinerary.plan: Pelling Skywalk + Darap village + cheese factory visit + local cuisine

itinerary.title: Bridge & Views
itinerary.plan: Singshore Bridge (highest in Sikkim) + buffer day for clear views/relaxation

itinerary.title: Departure
itinerary.plan: Pelling → NJP → Train to Kolkata

bookingTips: Book Kanchenjunga-facing room — sunrise views are life-changing
October–November has the clearest mountain views
Combine with Yuksom for complete West Sikkim experience
Try local cheese from Darap village cheese factory
Pemayangtse Monastery is best visited early morning for peaceful vibes

shortDescription: Pristine beaches, coral reefs, and colonial history in the Bay of Bengal
description: The Andaman Islands offer India's most stunning tropical beaches, world-class snorkeling and diving, and poignant colonial history. From Radhanagar Beach (Asia's best beach) to the haunting Cellular Jail, from vibrant coral reefs to bioluminescent waters, these islands are an escape into paradise just 2 hours from Kolkata.
landscape: Tropical islands, white sandy beaches, coral reefs, clear blue sea
permits: Not required for most islands (restricted for some tribal areas)
seasonNote: Peak season is December–February. Monsoon (June–September) has rough seas. Book ferries well in advance.
keyAttractions: Radhanagar Beach — Rated Asia's best beach, stunning sunsets
Cellular Jail — British colonial prison, emotional Light & Sound show
Elephant Beach — Snorkeling, water sports, coral views
Neil Island — Pristine beaches, natural rock bridge
Scuba Diving — World-class dive sites at Havelock

itinerary.title: Travel Day
itinerary.plan: Flight: Kolkata → Port Blair (2 hours). Cellular Jail Light & Sound show.

itinerary.title: Havelock Arrival
itinerary.plan: Ferry: Port Blair → Havelock Island (2-3 hours). Radhanagar Beach sunset.

itinerary.title: Beach & Water Sports
itinerary.plan: Elephant Beach snorkeling + water sports + kayaking + beach time

itinerary.title: Neil Island
itinerary.plan: Ferry: Havelock → Neil Island. Bharatpur Beach + Natural Rock Bridge sunset.

itinerary.title: Island Exploration
itinerary.plan: Laxmanpur Beach sunrise + cycling around Neil + local seafood feast

itinerary.title: Return to Port Blair
itinerary.plan: Ferry: Neil → Port Blair. Ross Island + North Bay snorkeling + markets

itinerary.title: Departure
itinerary.plan: Port Blair sightseeing + Flight: Port Blair → Kolkata

bookingTips: Book flights 2-3 months ahead for best prices
Book government ferry (Makruzz/Green Ocean) online in advance
Radhanagar Beach sunset is unmissable — arrive by 4 PM
Cellular Jail Light & Sound show is emotional — don't miss it
Try fresh seafood — lobster, crab, and fish are specialties

shortDescription: High-altitude desert with ancient monasteries, pristine lakes, and dramatic landscapes
description: Leh-Ladakh is India's ultimate adventure destination — a high-altitude desert where ancient Buddhist monasteries perch on cliffs, turquoise lakes shimmer at impossible altitudes, and some of the world's highest motorable passes test your limits. From Pangong's changing colors to Nubra's sand dunes, this is landscape on an epic scale.
landscape: High-altitude Himalayan desert, lakes, passes, monasteries
permits: Required for Nubra, Pangong, Tso Moriri, and border areas
seasonNote: Roads open only in summer. June–August is peak season. Acclimatization is essential — spend 2 days in Leh first.
keyAttractions: Pangong Lake — Iconic high-altitude lake with changing colors
Khardung La Pass — One of the world's highest motorable passes (5,359m)
Nubra Valley — Sand dunes, Bactrian camels, Diskit Monastery
Thiksey Monastery — 'Mini Potala Palace' with stunning architecture
Magnetic Hill — Optical illusion where vehicles appear to defy gravity

itinerary.title: Travel Day
itinerary.plan: Flight: Kolkata → Delhi → Leh. Rest and acclimatize. Evening Leh market walk.

itinerary.title: Acclimatization
itinerary.plan: Leh Palace + Shanti Stupa + local monastery visits + hydrate & rest

itinerary.title: Nubra Valley
itinerary.plan: Leh → Nubra Valley via Khardung La Pass. Diskit Monastery + sand dunes.

itinerary.title: Nubra Exploration
itinerary.plan: Bactrian camel ride + Hunder village + Sumur monastery + valley exploration

itinerary.title: Pangong Lake
itinerary.plan: Nubra → Pangong Lake via Shyok route. Evening at the stunning lake.

itinerary.title: Return to Leh
itinerary.plan: Pangong sunrise + drive back to Leh via Chang La. Hemis Monastery visit.

itinerary.title: Departure
itinerary.plan: Thiksey Monastery sunrise + Flight: Leh → Delhi → Kolkata

bookingTips: Acclimatize for 2 days in Leh — altitude sickness is serious
Carry Diamox (acetazolamide) for altitude — consult doctor before trip
Book shared Innova/Scorpio for circuit — cheaper than private taxi
Pangong Lake camps fill fast — book in advance during peak season
Carry warm layers — temperatures drop dramatically at night

shortDescription: Pristine high-altitude lake far from the crowds of Pangong
description: Tso Moriri, at 4,522m, is Ladakh's hidden gem — a pristine alpine lake surrounded by the Changthang plateau's stark beauty. Less crowded than Pangong, it offers authentic encounters with Changpa nomads, rare wildlife (including Tibetan wild ass), and a tranquility that commercial Ladakh has lost. For true adventurers seeking solitude.
landscape: High-altitude alpine lake, remote Changthang plateau
seasonNote: Roads open only in summer. Very remote — prepare for basic facilities. Wildlife spotting best in early summer.
keyAttractions: Tso Moriri Lake — Pristine high-altitude lake, less crowded than Pangong
Korzok Monastery — Ancient monastery on the lake shore
Tso Kar Lake — White salt lake with flamingos and wildlife
Changthang Plateau — Nomadic Changpa settlements, yaks
Wildlife — Tibetan wild ass (Kiang), marmots, migratory birds

itinerary.title: Travel Day
itinerary.plan: Flight: Kolkata → Delhi → Leh. Rest and acclimatize in Leh.

itinerary.title: Acclimatization
itinerary.plan: Shanti Stupa + Leh Palace + local market + hydrate and rest

itinerary.title: Journey to Lake
itinerary.plan: Leh → Korzok (Tso Moriri) via Chumathang hot springs (7-8 hours). Evening at lake.

itinerary.title: Lake Exploration
itinerary.plan: Tso Moriri lake circuit + Korzok monastery + wildlife spotting + Changpa village

itinerary.title: Salt Lake Return
itinerary.plan: Return via Tso Kar (white salt lake) + wildlife spotting + arrive Leh evening.

itinerary.title: Monastery Day
itinerary.plan: Hemis Monastery + Thiksey Monastery + Shey Palace + Leh market

itinerary.title: Departure
itinerary.plan: Early monastery visit + Flight: Leh → Delhi → Kolkata

bookingTips: Much less touristy than Pangong — true wilderness experience
Korzok has basic homestays — carry sleeping bag for extra warmth
Combine with Pangong for extended 9–10 day Ladakh trip
Carry snacks and water — very limited shops en route
Best for wildlife enthusiasts and photography lovers

shortDescription: Apple orchards, dramatic gorges, and the mystical Kinnaur Kailash
description: Kinnaur Valley, where the Sutlej River carves through dramatic gorges, is a land of apple orchards, ancient temples, and the sacred Kinnaur Kailash peak. From the last Indian village of Chitkul to the stunning views of Kalpa, this is Himachal's most beautiful circuit. Visit during apple season for orchards laden with red and green treasures.
landscape: Apple orchards, Kinnaur Kailash, Sutlej river valley
permits: Inner Line Permit for areas near Tibet border
bestSeason: April to June, September to November
seasonNote: Apple season (August–October) is spectacular. Winter has heavy snow, roads may close. Spring has wildflowers.
keyAttractions: Chitkul — Last Indian village on Tibet border, stunning valley
Kalpa — Kinnaur Kailash sunrise views, apple orchards
Sangla Valley — Picturesque valley with Kamru Fort
Bhimakali Temple — Ancient temple at Sarahan
Sutlej River — Dramatic gorges and river views

itinerary.title: Travel Day
itinerary.plan: Train: Kolkata → Chandigarh (overnight). Or fly to Delhi + bus/taxi.

itinerary.title: Sarahan Arrival
itinerary.plan: Road: Chandigarh → Sarahan (9 hours). Bhimakali Temple evening darshan.

itinerary.title: Sangla Valley
itinerary.plan: Sarahan → Sangla Valley. Apple orchards + Kamru Fort + village walk.

itinerary.title: Last Village
itinerary.plan: Sangla → Chitkul (last Indian village). Tibet border views + local culture.

itinerary.title: Kalpa Views
itinerary.plan: Chitkul → Kalpa via Reckong Peo. Kinnaur Kailash sunset views.

itinerary.title: Kalpa Exploration
itinerary.plan: Kinnaur Kailash sunrise + Suicide Point + monastery + apple orchard walk

itinerary.title: Departure
itinerary.plan: Kalpa → Shimla → Train/Flight to Kolkata

bookingTips: Apple season (August–October) is magical — buy fresh from orchards
Combine with Spiti Valley for ultimate Himachal circuit
Chitkul homestays offer authentic Kinnauri experience
Inner Line Permit needed for Chitkul — available at Reckong Peo
Carry warm layers — temperatures drop significantly at night

shortDescription: Coffee plantations, tribal heritage, and India's most scenic toy train journey
description: Araku Valley, nestled in the Eastern Ghats, offers one of India's most spectacular train journeys through 58 tunnels and across deep valleys. This tribal heartland produces world-class Araku coffee, houses million-year-old limestone caves, and preserves the authentic culture of Andhra's indigenous tribes. Combined with Vizag's beaches, it's a perfect East Coast escape.
landscape: Coffee plantations, tribal culture, Eastern Ghats hills
seasonNote: Pleasant weather. Summer (April–June) is hot. Monsoon creates lush greenery but may have landslides.
keyAttractions: Toy Train Journey — 58 tunnels, spectacular Eastern Ghats valley views
Borra Caves — Million-year-old limestone caves, largest in India
Araku Coffee — Fresh coffee plantation tours and tasting
Tribal Museum — Authentic heritage of Andhra's indigenous tribes
Vizag Beaches — RK Beach, Rushikonda, Submarine Museum

itinerary.title: Travel Day
itinerary.plan: Train: Kolkata → Visakhapatnam (overnight). Evening RK Beach + seafood.

itinerary.title: Beach Day
itinerary.plan: Rushikonda Beach + Kailasagiri ropeway + Submarine Museum + evening Vizag exploration

itinerary.title: Scenic Train
itinerary.plan: Toy train: Vizag → Araku (6 hours, 58 tunnels!). Evening Araku exploration.

itinerary.title: Caves & Coffee
itinerary.plan: Borra Caves + Tribal Museum + coffee plantation visit + local bamboo craft

itinerary.title: Valley Exploration
itinerary.plan: Padmapuram Gardens + Chaparai waterfalls + tribal village visit + Araku coffee shopping

itinerary.title: Return to Vizag
itinerary.plan: Return to Vizag by road. INS Kurusura Submarine Museum + local market.

itinerary.title: Departure
itinerary.plan: Morning beach visit + Train: Visakhapatnam → Kolkata

bookingTips: Book toy train tickets online in advance — fills up fast
Araku coffee is excellent — buy directly from plantations
Borra Caves entry is morning only — reach early
Combine with Vizag beaches for complete coastal experience
Try local bamboo chicken (chicken cooked in bamboo)

shortDescription: Endless tea estates, rare wildlife, and South India's largest waterfall nearby
description: Valparai, perched at 1,100m in the Anamalai Hills, is a tea lover's paradise. Drive through 40 hairpin bends to reach endless carpets of tea gardens, spot rare lion-tailed macaques, and day-trip to Athirapally Falls (South India's Niagara). This offbeat Western Ghats gem offers the beauty of Munnar without the crowds.
landscape: Tea estates, Western Ghats, rainforest, wildlife
seasonNote: Monsoon (June–August) has very heavy rainfall. Winter mornings are misty and magical. Wildlife spotting best October–March.
keyAttractions: Tea Estates — Endless green carpets of premium tea gardens
Athirapally Falls — South India's largest waterfall (day trip)
Lion-tailed Macaques — Rare endemic primate sightings
Sholayar Dam — Scenic reservoir surrounded by forests
40 Hairpin Bends — Thrilling drive up from Pollachi

itinerary.title: Travel Day
itinerary.plan: Flight: Kolkata → Coimbatore. Rest or explore Coimbatore.

itinerary.title: Hill Climb
itinerary.plan: Road: Coimbatore → Valparai via 40 hairpin bends (3 hours). Evening estate walk.

itinerary.title: Waterfalls & Dams
itinerary.plan: Sholayar Dam + Monkey Falls + Balaji Temple + wildlife spotting

itinerary.title: Tea Experience
itinerary.plan: Nallamudi viewpoint + tea factory visit + tea tasting + sunset at estate

itinerary.title: Athirapally Day
itinerary.plan: Day trip to Athirapally Falls (Kerala border) — South India's Niagara!

itinerary.title: Wildlife & Nature
itinerary.plan: Grass Hills wildlife spotting + local village visit + relaxation

itinerary.title: Departure
itinerary.plan: Valparai → Coimbatore → Flight to Kolkata

bookingTips: Stay in colonial tea estate bungalows for authentic experience
The 40 hairpin bends drive is an adventure — enjoy the views!
Look for lion-tailed macaques along forest roads — endemic to Western Ghats
Buy fresh tea directly from estates — much cheaper than shops
Athirapally is stunning after monsoon (September–November)
